<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/06/singapore-goes-ahead-relaxing-curbs-countries-learn-live-covid?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Learning to Live With Covid
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/06/singapore-goes-ahead-relaxing-curbs-countries-learn-live-covid?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A couple sit on a breakwater with a view of the city skyline in the Mari..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MTMxL2RhaWx5X2xpZmVfaW5fc2luZ2Fwb3JlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Nurphoto/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Countries that used to treat Covid-19 like the plague are starting to think of it more like new seasons of <em>American Idol</em>—just a fact of life.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Countries like Singapore.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With 67% of Singapore's nearly 5.7 million people fully vaccinated, officials said yesterday they’ll continue with their plan to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-06/singapore-eases-covid-curbs-in-shift-to-life-with-endemic-virus?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ease Covid-19 curbs</a> starting next week. In-person dining will resume, border controls will be loosened, and some employees can head back to the office. The reasoning is that perpetual reopening and closing of businesses will give the economy chronic whiplash.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>Singapore is the most significant example yet of a country pivoting from a “Covid Zero” approach to a strategy that accepts Covid as “endemic,” meaning it’s always present but remains at a manageable level. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">“Covid Zero” vs. “Living with Covid”</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Before its pivot, Singapore was part of a group of Asia-Pacific countries that played Whac-A-Mole to snuff out any trace of the coronavirus in an approach known as “Zero Covid.” And that’s still happening today:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>After recording more than 300 locally transmitted cases this week, China introduced </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/08/03/1024152774/panic-buying-and-transport-lockdowns-in-wuhan-it-feels-like-early-pandemic-again?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new curbs</a></span><span> on transportation in some cities and began mass testing residents in Wuhan, where the virus originated.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The state of Victoria, Australia, instituted its </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/05/world/the-australian-state-of-victoria-goes-back-into-lockdown.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sixth lockdown</a></span><span> on Thursday after detecting eight new cases. Australia is just 17% vaccinated.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Compare that to the more lax approach employed by countries like the US and the UK.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The UK </span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-57882029?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">scrapped</a></span><span> nearly all its pandemic curbs on July 19 in a strategy it called “Keep life moving.” After a Delta-fueled wave peaked in late July, cases have declined considerably...without new mitigation measures.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>As the story of Singapore shows, the only way to go from “Zero Covid” to “Living with Covid” is to mass-vaccinate your population, which largely prevents serious illness.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
JOBS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/06/us-hiring-surges-employers-add-943000-jobs-july?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Jobs Report Almost Hits A Milli
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">US employers <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/06/business/economy/july-2021-jobs-report.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">added 943,000 jobs</a> in July, marking the best monthly performance since August 2020, and the unemployment rate ticked down to 5.4% from 5.9% in June. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some experts were just about ready to hang this report on their refrigerator. “I have yet to find a blemish in this jobs report. I’ve never before seen such a wonderful set of economic data,” Harvard economics professor Jason Furman <a href="https://twitter.com/jasonfurman/status/1423624548419870723?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wonderful indeed, especially for the leisure and hospitality industry, which accounted for 40% of the job gains.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>While the US economy is steadily clawing back the jobs it lost during the pandemic, the country remains 5.7 million jobs short of where it was pre-Covid. And it's becoming clear that jobs in some industries may never come back...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The motion picture and sound recording industries had 30.1% fewer jobs in July than in February 2020.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Employment in performing arts and spectator sports is 22.3% below pre-pandemic levels.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the big question is whether the most recent wave of the coronavirus, which started to ramp up after July's jobs data was collected, has slowed down the labor market’s recovery. We’ll find out next month. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENVIRONMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/06/dixie-fire-becomes-thirdlargest-fire-california-history?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Wildfires Scorch California, Greece, and Turkey
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/06/dixie-fire-becomes-thirdlargest-fire-california-history?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="TOPSHOT - A fire-damaged street sign marks Main Street in a decimated do..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MTMyL3RvcHNob3QtdXMtY2FsaWZvcm5pYS1maXIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Josh Edelson/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Dixie Fire in California became the <a href="https://www.sfgate.com/california-wildfires/article/Dixie-Fire-California-wildfire-third-largest-16369222.php?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">third-largest fire</a> in state history yesterday. The fire, which started on July 14, grew 110 square miles overnight from Thursday to Friday morning and has already consumed an area 3.5 times the size of Lake Tahoe. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The fire ripped through the historic downtown of Greenville, CA, on Wednesday and <a href="https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2021-08-05/devastating-dixie-fire-destroys-large-swath-of-greenville-other-towns-evacuated?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">destroyed</a> about 75% of the buildings there, including schools and the vast majority of businesses.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>No injuries or deaths have yet been reported.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Southern Europe is also burning. </strong>6,600+ miles away, firefighters in Greece <a href="https://apnews.com/article/europe-fires-athens-heat-waves-4fca06093b6e4c0c463210dfe7fb4cfb?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">battled</a> 154 active wildfires. The coast guard had to borrow fishing and tourist boats to evacuate hundreds of people by sea off the coast of Evia, Greece’s second-largest island. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Turkey has also suffered from its worst wildfires in decades for the last 10 days. <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/05/world/europe/southern-europe-wildfires.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Photos</a> and <a href="https://twitter.com/ianbremmer/status/1423699138332434438?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">videos</a> coming out of Southern Europe right now show the devastation.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> California and other Western states are experiencing a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/03/california-drought-cause-wideranging-industry-problems?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">historic drought</a> and heat wave this summer that scientists say are exacerbated by climate change. Last year was California’s worst fire season on record, and this year is on pace to top it.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/06/key-performance-indicators-august-7?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Wedding Crashers, obv</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>After a blissful year of avoiding the “Cha-Cha Slide,”<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>we regret to inform you that there will be <a href="https://www.axios.com/wedding-industry-backed-up-busy-pandemic-86d89a77-bfcd-465a-b70c-f747d4eea728.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more weddings</a> in the US in 2022 than in any year since 1984, according to market research firm The Wedding Report. It estimates that 2.5 million weddings will take place next year, compared to an average of 2.1 million weddings/year pre-pandemic and 1.2 million weddings in 2020.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Let’s gooooooooooo!!!!”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Millions of student borrowers in the US, probably, after the Biden administration <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2021/08/06/student-loan-payment-freeze-extended-502720?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">extended its freeze</a> on student loan payments through January 2022. It was set to expire next month.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The surprising benefits of talking to strangers. (<a href="https://www.theatlantic.com/family/archive/2021/08/why-we-should-talk-strangers-more/619642/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Atlantic</a>)</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MONEY MATTERS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/06/money-mattersnavigating-small-business-taxes?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Money Matters: Navigating Small Business Taxes
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>In this Summer 2021 segment, the Brew’s personal finance writer Ryan Lasker is nose-diving into our inbox to address your personal finance questions. </em><a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24127283.23936/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9tMDZUYmRVUz91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B5ca46cdd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Submit your money woes here</em></a><em>.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">I am looking to start a freelance graphic design business but don’t know where to start, especially when it comes to taxes. How do I know what items can be written off, and how do I keep track of them?—Haley</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Before you do anything (like taking on clients), you’ll need to form a legal business, which matters in part because your structure determines <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/03/ccorp-vs-passthrough-taxes-whats-difference?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">how you’re taxed</a>. Freelancers often open LLCs, which can protect your personal assets from business debt. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Next, test-drive accounting software (I like QuickBooks Self-Employed and FreshBooks.) Pick one that creates functional invoices, makes inputting expenses easy, and is in your budget. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now you’re open for business! Every expense you incur—from software to coffees with clients—goes in the software. Every dollar you earn, too. Keep receipts for <em>everything</em>. As you correctly surmised, expenses ≠ write-offs. Simply put, write-offs (aka deductions) are <em>ordinary and necessary </em>costs to your business. Photoshop? Yep. A Manet for your home office? No. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Truth is, it’s not that simple. There are special rules for deducting startup costs. You might need to make estimated tax payments quarterly. And we haven’t even talked about tax credits. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>If taxes are the 4x100 relay, you’ll run a great first leg by keeping really<em> </em>good track of your income and expenses. Let a tax pro take it to the finish line for at least the first couple of years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><em>PS:</em></strong><em> Starting August 17, Ryan will be writing a twice-weekly personal finance newsletter to make you smarter about your money. </em><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/money-scoop/subscribe?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Become one of the first subscribers</em></a><em>.</em></p>

In-person dining will resume, border controls will be loosened, and some employees can head back to the office. The reasoning is that perpetual reopening and closing of businesses will give the economy chronic whiplash.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eSingapore is the most significant example yet of a country pivoting from a “Covid Zero” approach to a strategy that accepts Covid as “endemic,” meaning it’s always present but remains at a manageable level. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e“Covid Zero” vs. “Living with Covid”\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBefore its pivot, Singapore was part of a group of Asia-Pacific countries that played Whac-A-Mole to snuff out any trace of the coronavirus in an approach known as “Zero Covid.” And that’s still happening today:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAfter recording more than 300 locally transmitted cases this week, China introduced \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/08/03/1024152774/panic-buying-and-transport-lockdowns-in-wuhan-it-feels-like-early-pandemic-again?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew curbs\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on transportation in some cities and began mass testing residents in Wuhan, where the virus originated.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe state of Victoria, Australia, instituted its \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/05/world/the-australian-state-of-victoria-goes-back-into-lockdown.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esixth lockdown\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on Thursday after detecting eight new cases. Australia is just 17% vaccinated.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCompare that to the more lax approach employed by countries like the US and the UK.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe UK \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-57882029?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003escrapped\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e nearly all its pandemic curbs on July 19 in a strategy it called “Keep life moving.” After a Delta-fueled wave peaked in late July, cases have declined considerably...without new mitigation measures.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eAs the story of Singapore shows, the only way to go from “Zero Covid” to “Living with Covid” is to mass-vaccinate your population, which largely prevents serious illness.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: Milli\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUS employers \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/06/business/economy/july-2021-jobs-report.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadded 943,000 jobs\u003c/a\u003e in July, marking the best monthly performance since August 2020, and the unemployment rate ticked down to 5.4% from 5.9% in June. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome experts were just about ready to hang this report on their refrigerator. “I have yet to find a blemish in this jobs report. I’ve never before seen such a wonderful set of economic data,” Harvard economics professor Jason Furman \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/jasonfurman/status/1423624548419870723?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweeted\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWonderful indeed, especially for the leisure and hospitality industry, which accounted for 40% of the job gains.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eWhile the US economy is steadily clawing back the jobs it lost during the pandemic, the country remains 5.7 million jobs short of where it was pre-Covid. And it's becoming clear that jobs in some industries may never come back...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe motion picture and sound recording industries had 30.1% fewer jobs in July than in February 2020.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEmployment in performing arts and spectator sports is 22.3% below pre-pandemic levels.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe big question is whether the most recent wave of the coronavirus, which started to ramp up after July's jobs data was collected, has slowed down the labor market’s recovery. We’ll find out next month. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Dixie Fire in California became the \u003ca href=\"https://www.sfgate.com/california-wildfires/article/Dixie-Fire-California-wildfire-third-largest-16369222.php?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethird-largest fire\u003c/a\u003e in state history yesterday. The fire, which started on July 14, grew 110 square miles overnight from Thursday to Friday morning and has already consumed an area 3.5 times the size of Lake Tahoe. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe fire ripped through the historic downtown of Greenville, CA, on Wednesday and \u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2021-08-05/devastating-dixie-fire-destroys-large-swath-of-greenville-other-towns-evacuated?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edestroyed\u003c/a\u003e about 75% of the buildings there, including schools and the vast majority of businesses.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNo injuries or deaths have yet been reported.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSouthern Europe is also burning. \u003c/strong\u003e6,600+ miles away, firefighters in Greece \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/europe-fires-athens-heat-waves-4fca06093b6e4c0c463210dfe7fb4cfb?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebattled\u003c/a\u003e 154 active wildfires. The coast guard had to borrow fishing and tourist boats to evacuate hundreds of people by sea off the coast of Evia, Greece’s second-largest island. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTurkey has also suffered from its worst wildfires in decades for the last 10 days. \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/05/world/europe/southern-europe-wildfires.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ePhotos\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/ianbremmer/status/1423699138332434438?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evideos\u003c/a\u003e coming out of Southern Europe right now show the devastation.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e California and other Western states are experiencing a \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/03/california-drought-cause-wideranging-industry-problems?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehistoric drought\u003c/a\u003e and heat wave this summer that scientists say are exacerbated by climate change. style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nMoney Matters: Navigating Small Business Taxes\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eIn this Summer 2021 segment, the Brew’s personal finance writer Ryan Lasker is nose-diving into our inbox to address your personal finance questions. \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24127283.23936/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9tMDZUYmRVUz91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B5ca46cdd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eSubmit your money woes here\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eI am looking to start a freelance graphic design business but don’t know where to start, especially when it comes to taxes. How do I know what items can be written off, and how do I keep track of them?—Haley\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBefore you do anything (like taking on clients), you’ll need to form a legal business, which matters in part because your structure determines \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/03/ccorp-vs-passthrough-taxes-whats-difference?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehow you’re taxed\u003c/a\u003e. Freelancers often open LLCs, which can protect your personal assets from business debt. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNext, test-drive accounting software (I like QuickBooks Self-Employed and FreshBooks.) Pick one that creates functional invoices, makes inputting expenses easy, and is in your budget. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow you’re open for business! Every expense you incur—from software to coffees with clients—goes in the software. Every dollar you earn, too. Keep receipts for \u003cem\u003eeverything\u003c/em\u003e. As you correctly surmised, expenses ≠ write-offs. Simply put, write-offs (aka deductions) are \u003cem\u003eordinary and necessary \u003c/em\u003ecosts to your business. Photoshop? Yep. A Manet for your home office? No. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTruth is, it’s not that simple. There are special rules for deducting startup costs. You might need to make estimated tax payments quarterly. And we haven’t even talked about tax credits. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eIf taxes are the 4x100 relay, you’ll run a great first leg by keeping really\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003egood track of your income and expenses. Let a tax pro take it to the finish line for at least the first couple of years.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong
